description: User registration endpoint supporting both GET (form display) and POST (registration submission). Accepts username, password, first_name, last_name, and email as registration parameters. Returns HTTP 200 with registration form on GET, processes registration and redirects (302) on successful POST.
notes: Public registration endpoint. GET returns HTML form, POST creates new user account. Successful registration returns 302 redirect to /login with flash message in session cookie. No apparent registration restrictions or email validation. Potential for mass account creation or abuse.",
